data.title: On the night Great
data.text:
Really lively place, order quickly taken friendly staff, my wife ordered the Cod and Chips and being from Yorkshire (uk) with a bit of trepidation, I went for the Steak Taco's, served with Alopino chilli's, diced salad.
Drinks Fat tire beer, and a glass of Merlot.
Waiting time considering the amount of customers reasonable.
Wife was truly surprised at the quality of her meal. (Well done)
Mine was lovely and nicely finished with the beer.

data.title: Good Atmosphere
data.text: Went here in Oct 2016, food not great and beer a bit expensive. However it's a great spot for some live music and dancing. We enjoyed the blues band "The West Temple Tail Draggers". excellent. It's a fun place with good staff but toilets could do with a makeover. But if you want a bit of enjoyment it's worth a visit.

data.title: great food
data.text: Excellent place.. the day we visited they were playing latin music.. so we could enjoy some good dancing.. great food and beers..

data.title: Fun place
data.text: This is a fun place to go for a date. If it's warm enough sit on the roof, they have misters during the summer to keep you cool. The food is good and the service was good as well. If your visiting or local I would eat here.

data.title: Nothing special.
data.text: Warm draft beer in plastic pint "glasses", same fried pub grub you can get anywhere. Upstairs deck was noisy, lots of loud foul language.  Service was mediocre. Ladies' room was filthy.

data.title: Good selection of dark beers and good food
data.text: Wandered by the Green PIg while walking downtown in SLC. We were hungry and tired, so gave it a second look and I'm glad we did. I ordered the blackened salmon tacos which were great with the jalapeno blackberry sauce. It is a sports bar with a generally young clientele, so we are not talking quiet dining.

data.title: Misty Roof-top sliders
data.text: Repaired to Green Pig after 40 mins of urban arts inspection at SLC Urban Arts fest at Gallivan Ctr..Pig is a mere two blocks away...art inspection is thirsty work...very...first floor of Pig was wall-to-wall Sunday football...worse than art inspection...fled upstairs to rooftop...shrouded in mist...not the altitude....SLC quite dry...mist spewing from misters in pipes every 10 inches about 3 feet above head...I know what a hydroponic tomato feels like...damp...however, drink specials ($3 tequila) and Goose IPA and excellent service came with the mists...pulled pork sliders quite good...not much of a view but nice not to have TV in surround-sound

data.title: Fun bar in the center of town
data.text: We ate here looking for some pub grub and the rooftop deck was what sold us! Food was good for bar food, and the beers were humungous! Only complaint was that after a 13 mile run and 2 (huge!) beers the red tarp over the deck was pretty obnoxious and made everything turn red!

data.title: Great atmosphere, nice staff, and good food!
data.text: Thought it was going to be a shady divey place on my walk there, but pleasantly welcomed arriving around 3:30.  The bartender had good beer recommendations, also recommended the cuban with a fried egg and it was excellent.  Oh and they had good old school soul music playing.  Great place to check out!

data.title: Great lunch spot, great burgers, easy to find downtown
data.text: Came here with some coworkers. Great burgers and was very fresh. Good environment to hold a business lunch. Not too noisy. Had screens with sports on if you want to relax. It is a pub, so obviously not suited for children. Amber was our sever today and she was fantastic. Always had our drinks filled, quick service and very friendly. Our group enjoyed it very much. Will return again. Parking on the street or on Exchange Pl parking garage.

data.title: Lunch
data.text: Green Pig was so friendly to our dog Yogi.  We loved it.  Sat up on the roof patio.  Food was really good...bloody marys are really yummy.  Thanks for letting us bring our dog.

data.title: Best food we had in Salt Lake City
data.text: My boss made a reservation at the Green Pig and the food was excellent.  Make a reservation, it can get crowded, this is a popular spot.

data.title: Best Bar in Salt Lake
data.text: Love the food and drinks. Friendly staff and always a great crowd. The owner is very accommodating. They have the best selection of tequila and a great rooftop bar which is hard to find in Salt Lake City.

data.title: Best bar in SLC hands down!
data.text: Between the service, the food, and the people this place can't be beat.  Also the best Sunday ticket action, live music, and triva around.

data.title: Love, Love, Love this place!
data.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat while in Salt Lake City.  The food has been consistently good and reasonable prices.  I strongly suggest you give it a try!

data.title: Reuben Soup on a Rooftop Patio
data.text: The Green Pig has the BEST soup.  The Reuben soup isn't available every day, but if it is when you're there then try it.  Their clam chowder is also amazing.   I also love the fish tacos and the avocado rolls (like mexican-ish eggrolls).  The service is always good, though sometimes slow when it gets really busy.  And I love the rooftop patio.

data.title: Rooftop lounge to drink and dine on pub food
data.text: Welcoming and efficient staff only added to the charm of being outside on the rooftop patio looking out over the city for drinks and pub food.

data.title: Great place in downtown
data.text: The food here is really good. I ate a pizza and it was delicious. They also have an upper deck. The beers are good to sample as well.

data.title: Great food, nice place
data.text: The blackened salmon tacos are one the best meals you can get SLC.  They are fresh and delicious.  The service is great even when busy.  This is very very rare for a SLC bar.

data.title: Best Sunday Brunch in SLC
data.text: Brunch is a very common thing. Here in SLC, almost everywhere offers up a brunch of some sorts and I've been to all of them. But the Green Pig by far has the best food out of any of the others. Not sure who is working the kitchen there, but they are doing it right! The green chili over potatoes is to die for. $15 bucks will get you an all you can eat GOOD buffet and a cold mimosa. Simply can't be beat.
